results.headline: GUARDING TESS (MOVIE)

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Guarding Tess

results.summary_short: Feisty ex-first lady and young aide. Starts funny, then fumbles.

results.headline: GERMINAL (MOVIE)

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Germinal

results.summary_short: Zola's coal miners, in Gallic ``Grapes of Wrath.'' Strong impact but paper-thin characters, little psychological stretch. Has novel's sweep, purpose.

results.headline: FOUR WEDDINGS AND A FUNERAL (MOVIE)

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Four Weddings and A Funeral

results.summary_short: Looking for love at all the right events. Festive and funny.

results.summary_short: Burglar and hostages in Connecticut. Diverting surprise, gleefully irreverent.

results.summary_short: Young English clergyman and wife in 1930's Australia. Soft-core, high-minded daydream about the sensuality of art.

results.summary_short: Car-chase satire. Loud, churning mess, but often amusing.

results.summary_short: Pregnant and alone in Brooklyn, by choice. Funny, touching Davis.
